Memorandum by the Home Secretary.The object of this Bill is to enable Regulations to be made for the protection of the health of painters using lead paint. I circulated the Bill to the Cabinet in April last (C.P.202(25)) a,nd the Bill was introduced last Session but made no progress.The Bill will be criticised by the Labour Party on the ground that it does not include any provision as to the prohibition of lead paint for internal work, but I believe there will be no serious objection to the proposal for Regulations. A draft of the Regulations was in fact agreed upon between the Home Office and the industry three years ago, but they cannot be brought into force until legislation is passed.This Bill might be introduced into the House of -Lords.W.J.H.5th February, 1926.
